title: Pascal Lochard
text:
Pascal Lochard (born September 17, 1990) is a <a href="Canadian%20football">Canadian football</a> <a href="running%20back">running back</a> for the <a href="Edmonton%20Eskimos">Edmonton Eskimos</a> of the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a> (CFL). He was drafted by the <a href="BC%20Lions">BC Lions</a> in the second round of the <a href="2014%20CFL%20Draft">2014 CFL Draft</a>. He played <a href="Canadian%20Interuniversity%20Sport%20football">CIS football</a> at <a href="Laval%20University">Laval University</a>. He has also been a member of the <a href="Winnipeg%20Blue%20Bombers">Winnipeg Blue Bombers</a> and <a href="Ottawa%20Redblacks">Ottawa Redblacks</a>.
College career.
Lochard was named the <a href="most%20valuable%20player">most valuable player</a> of the <a href="49th%20Vanier%20Cup">49th Vanier Cup</a>, winning the Ted Morris Memorial Trophy.
Professional career.
BC Lions.
Lochard was selected by the <a href="BC%20Lions">BC Lions</a> with the fourteenth pick in the <a href="2014%20CFL%20Draft">2014 CFL Draft</a>.
Winnipeg Blue Bombers.
Lochard signed with the <a href="Winnipeg%20Blue%20Bombers">Winnipeg Blue Bombers</a> on February 9, 2016.
Ottawa Redblacks.
Upon entering 2017 free agency, Lochard signed a two-year contract with the <a href="Ottawa%20Redblacks">Ottawa Redblacks</a>. He was released by the Redblacks on May 8, 2017.
Edmonton Eskimos.
Lochard was signed by the <a href="Edmonton%20Eskimos">Edmonton Eskimos</a> on May 26, 2017.
